alert.note: Alert for Gilmer; Gordon; Pickens (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 6:53AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Gilmer, eastern Gordon and Pickens Counties through 730 AM EDT... At 652 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Oakman to near Adairsville, and moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Calhoun, Jasper, Adairsville, Talking Rock, Fairmount, Ranger, Sequoyah Lake, Sonoraville, Talona, Redbud, Cartecay, Blaine, Talmadge, Oakman, Hinton and Roundtop. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 AM EDT for north central and northwestern Georgia.
